content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Sure, here is a function in Julia that should do what you're asking for:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::Markdown.MD)
    code_blocks = Markdown.Code[]
    for element in md.content
        if isa(element, Markdown.Code)
            push!(code_blocks, element)
        elseif isa(element, Markdown.List)
            for item in element.items
                if isa(item, Markdown.Code)
                    push!(code_blocks, item)
                end
            end
        end
    end

    code_strings = map(code_blocks) do code_block
        if code_block.language == "julia"
            return string(code_block.code, '\n')
        end
    end

    return join(filter(!isempty, code_strings))
end
```

This function works by iterating over the elements of the `Markdown.MD` object. If an element is a `Markdown.Code` object, it checks if the language is "julia" and if so, it
